s.text: Many people tell me they're downloading the print-out file and reading it on screen but offline.
Warren Buffett, America's second-richest man (after somebody whose name I've forgotten), has written that he's suspicious of anyone who talks of learning from his own mistakes.

Our original idea of a separate cover and contents page, united by theme music, has not, in our view, been a success, and we'll be reworking that in the weeks ahead.

Claims about readership tend to be even more dubious in the online world than they are in the world of traditional paper magazines.
We've recently reformatted the print-out edition to make it more attractive and reduce the number of pages (just 27 for the whole Thursday, Aug. 1, issue).
Warren Buffett, America's second-richest man (after somebody whose name I've forgotten), has written that he's suspicious of anyone who talks of learning from his own mistakes.
(They neglected to ask for the week off in their union contract.)
